subject: math

formulas.expression: Scalar projection of a on b = (a·b)/|b| ; Vector projection = ((a·b)/|b|^2) b
|a×b| = |a||b|sinθ ; a×b = determinant(i, j, k; ax, ay, az; bx, by, bz)
If a = ax i + ay j + az k then cosα = ax/|a|, cosβ = ay/|a|, cosγ = az/|a| and cos^2α+cos^2β+cos^2γ=1

shortcuts: Angle check fast: if a·b = 0 => θ = 90° (perpendicular). If a·b > 0 => acute, if a·b < 0 => obtuse.
Area questions: prefer cross product magnitude; avoid coordinate geometry expansion if not needed.
In options, check sign + zero conditions first (orthogonal/parallel) to eliminate quickly.
traps: Projection trap: divide by |b| vs |b|^2 — scalar projection uses |b|, vector projection uses |b|^2.
Direction cosines: students mix components with cosines; always normalize by |a|.
Cross product direction: right-hand rule; magnitude is positive, direction depends on order (a×b = -(b×a)).
